org.youscope.uielements

Class LiveStreamPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • org.youscope.uielements.ImagePanel
              • org.youscope.uielements.LiveStreamPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class LiveStreamPanel
extends ImagePanel
    A panel to configure, start and stop a live stream.
    Author:
    Moritz Lang
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      YouScopeFrameListener getFrameListener()
      Returns a frame listener which can be added to the frame to which this panel is added, taking care that the LiveStream automatically stops when the frame closes (and, that it automatically starts when the frame opens, if autostart is set to true).
      void saveSettings()
      Call this function such that the current channel settings get saved.
      void setAutoStartStream(boolean autostart)
      If set to true, the stream automatically starts when the window is made visible.
      void setFullScreen(boolean fullScreen)
      Set to true to show the LiveStream in full-screen mode.
      void setUserChoosesFullScreen(boolean userChooses)
      Set to true to display a button with which the user can choose on him/herself if the LiveStream should be shown in full-screen mode.
      void snapImage()
      Snaps a single image with the current settings.
      void startLiveStream()
      Starts the live stream.
      void stopLiveStream()
      Stops the live stream.
      void stopLiveStreamAndWait()
      Stops the live stream.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LiveStreamPanel

        public LiveStreamPanel(YouScopeClient client,
                       YouScopeServer server)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        client - YouScope client.
        server - YouScope server.

    • Method Detail

      • setFullScreen

        public void setFullScreen(boolean fullScreen)
        Set to true to show the LiveStream in full-screen mode. Set to fals again to stop full-sceen again.
        Parameters:
        fullScreen - True to start, false to stop full-screen.

      • saveSettings

        public void saveSettings()
        Call this function such that the current channel settings get saved. When starting a LiveStream again, the same settings will appear.

      • getFrameListener

        public YouScopeFrameListener getFrameListener()
        Returns a frame listener which can be added to the frame to which this panel is added, taking care that the LiveStream automatically stops when the frame closes (and, that it automatically starts when the frame opens, if autostart is set to true).
        Overrides:
        getFrameListener in class ImagePanel
        Returns:
        Frame listener.

      • setAutoStartStream

        public void setAutoStartStream(boolean autostart)
        If set to true, the stream automatically starts when the window is made visible. Note: the stream automatically stops if the frame is hidden. Has only an effect if #toFrame() is used.
        Parameters:
        autostart - true to automatically start imaging when frame shows up.

      • setUserChoosesFullScreen

        public void setUserChoosesFullScreen(boolean userChooses)
        Set to true to display a button with which the user can choose on him/herself if the LiveStream should be shown in full-screen mode. Default is false.
        Parameters:
        userChooses - True to display fullscreen button.

      • stopLiveStream

        public void stopLiveStream()
        Stops the live stream. Does nothing if live stream is not running. The call immediately returns, even if the stopping of the live stream takes longer.

      • stopLiveStreamAndWait

        public void stopLiveStreamAndWait()
        Stops the live stream. Does nothing if live stream is not running. The call returns after the live stream has stopped.

      • snapImage

        public void snapImage()
        Snaps a single image with the current settings.

      • startLiveStream

        public void startLiveStream()
        Starts the live stream. If the live stream is already running, it restarts it.
